org.ow2.chameleon.metric.measure
Class MeasuredQuantity<Q extends Quantity<Q>>

java.lang.Object
  org.ow2.chameleon.metric.Quantity<Q>
      org.ow2.chameleon.metric.measure.MeasuredQuantity<Q>

public class MeasuredQuantity<Q extends Quantity<Q>>
extends Quantity<Q>

Measured quantities are quantities with min and max derivation. The exact value is in the range [value - minDerivation, value + maxDerivation]. Measured values are immutable.

Field Detail

NOT_CAPTURED_QUANTITY

public static MeasuredQuantity NOT_CAPTURED_QUANTITY
A specific quantity used for measure that are invalid (because of a device failure, or issue in the response). This quantify uses a specific unit 'NaM' (not a measure) and has a zero-value.

minDerivation

public final double minDerivation
The min derivation.

maxDerivation

public final double maxDerivation
The max derivation.

isInRange

public boolean isInRange(double v)
Checks whether the given value is in the range of the measure.

Parameters:
v - the value to test
Returns:
true if the value is in the range, false otherwise.

isInRange

public boolean isInRange(Quantity<Q> q)
Checks whether the given quantity is in the range of the measure. The quantity is converted to the current quantity unit before applying the test.

Parameters:
q - the quantity
Returns:
true if the value of the given quantity converted to the current quantity's unit is in the range, false otherwise.

isNotCaptured

public boolean isNotCaptured()
Checks whether the measured value has an actual value or if the stored quantity is a mock representing a not captured value.

Returns:
true if the measured value reflects a not captured value

isExact

public boolean isExact()
Checks whether the measured quantity is exact (i.e. minDerivation = maxDerivation = 0).

Returns:
true is the measure is exact
